article.title: Anti-Dynamical Casimir Effect as a Resource for Work Extraction

multiple_choice_question.text: What phenomenon in the Rabi model allows for work extraction even with perturbative modulation amplitudes and moderate atom-field detunings?
What condition is crucial for achieving a finite average amount of work extraction from the atom-field system?
choices: The average number of excitations must remain constant.
The modulation frequency must be much lower than the cavity frequency.
The oscillations of the atomic population inversion must be synchronized with the atomic transition frequency modulation.
The atom-field coupling strength must be in the ultra-strong coupling regime.

multiple_choice_question.text: Why are multi-tone modulations more effective in extracting energy from the system when the field is initially in a thermal state?
choices: They allow for simultaneous manipulation of different energy level transitions, maximizing work extraction.
They suppress the detrimental effects of counter-rotating terms in the Rabi Hamiltonian.
They enable faster adiabatic cycles, leading to increased power output.
They facilitate the creation of entanglement between the atom and the field, enhancing energy extraction.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does the inclusion of dissipation affect the work extraction process in a realistic circuit QED setup?
choices: It completely inhibits work extraction, making the protocol unfeasible for practical implementations.
It leads to a smaller amount of extracted work compared to the lossless case, but periodic and aperiodic extraction are still possible.
It enhances work extraction by providing an additional channel for energy dissipation from the system.
It has negligible impact on work extraction as long as the system is kept at very low temperatures.
